questions.text: How often are Key Quality Indicators reported on the Quality Dashboard?

options.explanation: The Quality Dashboard is updated monthly, not weekly.
Per Section 5.4, the Quality Dashboard is published monthly for all departments.
Quarterly is the frequency for the Quarterly Quality Report, not the dashboard.
Annual frequency applies to the Annual Quality Trend Report.

questions.text: What is the escalation threshold for CAPA closure rate?

options.explanation: The target is â‰¥ 90% but the escalation threshold is lower.
90% is the target, not the escalation threshold.
Per Section 5.2, CAPA closure rate escalation is triggered when it falls below 80%.
70% is below the escalation threshold of 80%.

questions.text: When an adverse trend is identified that may have a safety impact, it must be escalated to risk management.
questions.explanation: Per Section 5.5, if an adverse trend is safety-related, it is escalated to risk management for a file update.

questions.text: Which analysis method is used to identify the top contributors to complaints?

options.explanation: Trend charts monitor KQIs over time but do not rank contributors.
Per Section 5.3, Pareto analysis is used to identify top contributors to complaints, defects, and nonconformances.
SWOT analysis is a strategic planning tool, not used for quality data analysis.
Monte Carlo simulation is not listed as an analysis method in this SOP.

questions.text: Data analysis outputs serve as input to which process?

options.explanation: While supplier data is one input, data analysis feeds into management review.
Per Section 5.6, data analysis outputs are a required input to management review per SOP-006.
Data analysis inputs to management review, not document control specifically.
Marketing is not a QMS process recipient of data analysis outputs.
